text: Ya'ad (, lit. Destiny or Goal) is a small moshav in northern Israel. Located near the city of Karmiel, it falls under the jurisdiction of Misgav Regional Council. In it had a population of . ==History== It was founded in 1974 by computer science graduates from the Technion next to the land where the Arab village of Mi'ar existed until 1947 and the independence of Israel ==References== ==External links== *Official website Category:Moshavim Category:Populated places in Northern District (Israel) Category:Populated places established in 1974 Category:1974 establishments in Israel
title: Ya'ad, Israel
